about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: There is no crosswalk and you see a pedestrian crossing your lane ahead. You should:

about.name: There is no crosswalk and you see a pedestrian crossing your lane ahead. You should:

hasPart.assesses: There is no crosswalk and you see a pedestrian crossing your lane ahead. You should: | There is no crosswalk and you see a pedestrian crossing your lane ahead. You should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: At an intersection where traffic is not controlled by traffic signal lights, drivers are required to yield the right-of-way to pedestrians within any crosswalk, marked or unmarked. Even if there is no crosswalk, yield to the pedestrian.

suggestedAnswer.text: Make eye contact with and then pass the pedestrian.

comment.text: Make eye contact with and then pass the pedestrian.

suggestedAnswer.text: Slow down as you pass the pedestrian.

comment.text: Slow down as you pass the pedestrian.

suggestedAnswer.text: Stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing the street.

comment.text: Stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing the street.

acceptedAnswer.text: Stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing the street.

comment.text: Stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing the street.

answerExplanation.text: At an intersection where traffic is not controlled by traffic signal lights, drivers are required to yield the right-of-way to pedestrians within any crosswalk, marked or unmarked. Even if there is no crosswalk, yield to the pedestrian.

comment.text: There is no crosswalk and you see a pedestrian crossing your lane ahead. You should: | At an intersection where traffic is not controlled by traffic signal lights, drivers are required to yield the right-of-way to pedestrians within any crosswalk, marked or unmarked. Even if there is no crosswalk, yield to the pedestrian.

hasPart.name: When taking any medicine, you should:

about.name: When taking any medicine, you should:

hasPart.assesses: When taking any medicine, you should: | When taking any medicine, you should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Legal medications, both prescription and over-the-counter, can potentially impair your ability to drive. Always consult with your doctor or pharmacist if you have questions about how a particular drug or drug combination will affect your ability to drive. You should particularly make a point of talking with your doctor if they give you a prescription for a tranquilizer or sedative.

suggestedAnswer.text: Consult your doctor about the effects before driving.

comment.text: Consult your doctor about the effects before driving.
Have someone follow you home.

suggestedAnswer.text: Keep your window open and drive more slowly.

comment.text: Keep your window open and drive more slowly.

acceptedAnswer.text: Consult your doctor about the effects before driving.

comment.text: Consult your doctor about the effects before driving.

answerExplanation.text: Legal medications, both prescription and over-the-counter, can potentially impair your ability to drive. Always consult with your doctor or pharmacist if you have questions about how a particular drug or drug combination will affect your ability to drive. You should particularly make a point of talking with your doctor if they give you a prescription for a tranquilizer or sedative.

comment.text: When taking any medicine, you should: | Legal medications, both prescription and over-the-counter, can potentially impair your ability to drive. Always consult with your doctor or pharmacist if you have questions about how a particular drug or drug combination will affect your ability to drive. You should particularly make a point of talking with your doctor if they give you a prescription for a tranquilizer or sedative.

hasPart.text: Use low beam headlights when driving in rain, snow, sleet, or fog. High beam headlights in adverse weather conditions lower visibility by reflecting off the precipitation and back into the driver's eyes.

comment.text: Low beam headlights.
High beam headlights.
Parking lights.
Low beam headlights.

answerExplanation.text: Use low beam headlights when driving in rain, snow, sleet, or fog. High beam headlights in adverse weather conditions lower visibility by reflecting off the precipitation and back into the driver's eyes.

comment.text: To improve visibility lowered by rain or fog, drivers should use their: | Use low beam headlights when driving in rain, snow, sleet, or fog. High beam headlights in adverse weather conditions lower visibility by reflecting off the precipitation and back into the driver's eyes.

hasPart.name: This yellow sign means:
hasPart.assesses: This yellow sign means: | This yellow sign means: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Some warning signs have a fluorescent yellow-green background. These signs warn of upcoming conditions, including roads with curves and sharp turns.

suggestedAnswer.text: There is a sharp turn to the right.

comment.text: There is a sharp turn to the right.
The lane must turn right.

suggestedAnswer.text: A right turn is permitted on a green arrow only.

comment.text: A right turn is permitted on a green arrow only.

acceptedAnswer.text: There is a sharp turn to the right.

comment.text: There is a sharp turn to the right.

answerExplanation.text: Some warning signs have a fluorescent yellow-green background. These signs warn of upcoming conditions, including roads with curves and sharp turns.

hasPart.text: A triangular yellow sign with black lettering indicates a no passing zone. It will appear on the left side of a two-way, two-lane roadway at the beginning of an area where prohibitive pavement markings are also used.

comment.text: No passing zone.
Slow-moving vehicle.
Two-way traffic.
No passing zone.

answerExplanation.text: A triangular yellow sign with black lettering indicates a no passing zone. It will appear on the left side of a two-way, two-lane roadway at the beginning of an area where prohibitive pavement markings are also used.

hasPart.text: When approaching a roundabout, slow down. A roundabout is designed to be driven at a low speed.

comment.text: Increase your speed.
Decrease your speed.
Maintain your speed.
Decrease your speed.

answerExplanation.text: When approaching a roundabout, slow down. A roundabout is designed to be driven at a low speed.
